meanings.sent1: Her bohemianisms included painting on the walls and wearing mismatched socks.
meanings.sent2: The neighborhood was known for its bohemianisms, with artists and musicians living together.
meanings.sent3: At the party, his bohemianisms stood out as he danced with a pineapple on his head.
meanings.sent4: Her bohemianisms were like a colorful tapestry woven into the fabric of the community.
meanings.sent5: The bohemianisms of the group made them seem like free spirits roaming the earth.

meanings.definition: Bohemianisms: the practices or beliefs of bohemians
meanings.sent1: Studying the bohemianisms of the past helped her understand their way of life.
meanings.sent2: The bookstore was filled with books on bohemianisms and counterculture.
meanings.sent3: His dedication to bohemianisms led him to start a poetry club in the park.
meanings.sent4: The bohemianisms of the group were like a roadmap to living authentically.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the bohemianisms of different cultures opened her mind to new possibilities.

meanings.definition: Bohemianisms: the characteristic style or spirit of bohemians
meanings.sent1: Her outfit exuded bohemianisms with its flowy fabrics and bold accessories.
meanings.sent2: The cafe was decorated with bohemianisms, from dreamcatchers to vintage posters.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at cooking dinner had a touch of bohemianisms, resulting in a unique dish.
meanings.sent4: The city's architecture reflected the bohemianisms of its artistic residents.
meanings.sent5: The music festival captured the bohemianisms of the era, bringing people together in harmony.
